direction.raw_text: Hey, dudes. Check these out. Kent holds up a sleeveless t-shirt with a big cartoon guy on a motorcycle - with the words "Born to Be Wild! Daytona ride, 2005." It's horrifying.

direction.raw_text: We're all going to wear these on the trip. (MORE) "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 21.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That way everyone will know we're from the Cincinnati chapter. It'll also get you ten percent off at T.G.I.Fridays.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool! Born to be wild! Dudley grabs a shirt and starts to pull it over the t- shirt he already has on. Woody gives a look to Bob and Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, We'll talk about it tomorrow. But we don't need some trip to go "live." We are living. Free and wild.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The anniversary party is in full swing. DOUG is watching several guests dish steaming pasta and cream sauce out of a chaffing dish. He looks down at his plate of field greens and skinless chicken breast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Free and wild. Doug looks around the party. Several middle-aged couples are dancing on the living room floor. Others mingle, laughing... Everyone is having a great time, except Doug, who stands there, listless. Kelly walks up and kisses him on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, sweetie. Having fun?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. It's getting pretty late, though. Maybe we should kill the music. Drop a hint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's eight O'Clock. It started at seven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: oh. (THEN) Still, that's late. We should just flicker the lights on and off. People will get it. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 22.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People are having fun. Look at the Miltons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: THE LIVING ROOM. A happy-looking couple, THE MILTONS, are dancing around to Prince's "1999." Doug laughs. DOUG Oh, man. There should be laws against that... Is Fred having a seizure? KELLY No, Fred's having a good time. With his wife. Remember what that was like? DOUG Hey, we have fun all the time. But I'm not going to let myself look like that. He wears dress socks with shorts, too. I've seen it. Do you want me to do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't care. Why do you? Doug searches for a response, as ROGER, 70, Kelly's Dad, clinks his wine glass at the front of the room. ROGER Excuse me, everybody. I have a little toast. For my daughter and her husband. Roger winks at Doug and Kelly. Doug smiles weakly. DOUG (sotto, to Kelly) He's drunk. We should do something. ROGER I want to start by saying how proud I am of my son-in-law. DOUG (sotto, to Kelly) --No, he's fine. Let him talk. ROGER Now, I have to make an admission. Ten years ago, when Doug and Kelly got married. I was worried. Doug was a little wild... The guests laugh. Doug gives an unsure chuckle. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 23.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean, he had that old trans-am with the huge engine... Remember how he'd peel out of anywhere? Even the grocery parking lot after buying baby formula? The guests laugh again. Now Doug isn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or the way he'd just grab Kelly and run off to some crazy island to snorkel with something that thinks you're lunch. The guests continue to laugh. Kelly looks at Doug, now. She sees this is landing on him. He's getting upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, not anymore. He's now become the son-in-law I would have always hoped for. Responsible, reliable, and a great husband to my daughter. So cheers to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no. No cheers-- Because that wasn't an accurate toast. I'm still the same, shitty son-in-law I used to be. The guests laugh. They think he's joking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Doug. You should be proud! You've grown up! Cheers! The guests nod and clink their glasses. Doug shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grown up? No, I haven't. I'm still young. No cheers! Stop clinking!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug, stop it. You're being rude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, tell them I'm the same as I used to be, Kelly. Tell your Dad not to like me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not the same, Doug. The old Doug wouldn't have made fun of Fred Milton for dancing, because he would have been out there dancing himself. With me. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 24.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are you saying?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm saying you have changed. And frankly, i don't like it. I like you the way you were. I liked it when you weren't afraid of looking stupid. I liked it when we laughed. I liked it when we danced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'll dance! It's just this music is lame. People like me need a fresh beat! Doug walks over to the stereo and changes the station. "Cand Sho " h y-50 Cent starts playing. Doug nods along with the beat, as the guests all now stare at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling over music) Awwww, yeah. This is the shit! It ain't
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: anymore, man. Yeah! (SINGS ALONG) I take you to the... Andy shop-- Doug tries to confidently sing along, but struggles awkwardly, as he's obviously never heard the song before. KELLY (urging, to Doug) Honey, stop it. You're being an ass. DOUG What!? I thought this was what you wanted? I'm dancing! Doug starts grinding and shimmying to the beat. Kelly grits her teeth. DOUG (CONT'D) Come on, baby! Just because we're married ten years doesn't mea n we're old people. Let's dance! It fee ls goooood! Doug makes another spastic dance move, then suddenly grimaces and grabs his chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope, that feels bad--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug? What's wrong? Are you okay? "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 25.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I'm just-- Ow: That's-- Yeah, I should go to the hospital-- Doug staggers across the carpet as people run to help him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug is in a bed, with Kelly next to him. A DOCTOR enters with a chart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Mr. Matthews--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Matthews, actually.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, really? Great. Then, I can say this a lot easier. You had a hypertensive myocardial seizure. Doug nods confidently, then, after a moment:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a dentist, actually... I have no idea what you just said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Sorry. It looks like you had a stress-induced panic attack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stress-induced? I'm not stressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's probably been pretty buried. I actually see it a lot with middle-aged men. Work, family, it can take a toll on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not middle-aged. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 26.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I see that a lot, too. Anyway. We should have you out of here soon. The doctor smiles and exits the room. Kelly looks at Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am middle aged, aren't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Only mathematically. Doug takes this in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug, Let me ask you a question. When was the last time you sang a Bon Jovi song?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You used to sing Bon Jovi songs at the top of your lungs. Like you didn't care who heard you, or how dopey it sounded. Then one day, you just stopped. That's how it's been with everything. Romance, sense of humor, the way you used to give me that cocky little wink when you took off your shirt... It's all faded away, leaving just a shell of what you used to be. Why? Why no more Bon Jovi songs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. There's just a lot weighing me down these days, you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what? You have a great career, a perfect family. Money is fine. The only thing that could be weighing you down is me. Is it me? Are you tired of me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! of course, not. I could never be
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug stops himself, as it dawns on him. You can see the horror of realization creep across his face. He looks at Kelly, wide-eyed. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 27.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's me. I'm weighing me down. I'm not a guy I'd hang out with anymore, I'm... Me. What's cool about me? I don't even eat carbs. KELLY Then eat them. I'd rather have you sing than have a thirty-four waist. DOUG I still have a thirty-- KELLY No, you don't, Doug. I buy your pants. (THEN) Look. We've been married ten years. And personally, I'd like to be married fifty more, but if you stay like this... Then... I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are going to be married fifty more years, Kelly. I'm going to find old Doug. I just have to figure out where to look. Kelly takes a breath, and pulls out a map. She hands it to Doug, who looks at it. DOUG (CONT'D) Woody's map? KELLY I took it away from him at the party. He wouldn't stop waving it at Bob and Dudley. DOUG I thought you agreed it was a bad idea. KELLY It might be. But I'm desperate, Doug. I want us to be happy again. So go on it. It's my anniversary present to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? (considers, then) I only got you an ankle bracelet. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 28.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All I want is old Doug back. Please. This marriage can't survive without him. Doug takes this in, and smiles at her. She's a good wife, and he knows it. Suddenly, BOB enters the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug! Are you okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'm okay. Just stress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, man. Thank god.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Karen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, she's waiting in the parking--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A loud honk from the parking lot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's her. Bob looks out the window nervously. Kelly looks at Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You all need this trip. Doug gives her a knowing nod, then turns to Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob. Let's forget about Daytona Bike week. Let's ride across U.S. 50.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Are you sure? I mean, We'll be leaving behind everything we're used to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The horn honks again from outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C.) (yelling from parking lot) Bob!? You said two minutes! I'm not circling!! Bob cringes. Doug shares a look with Kelly, then to Bob: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 29.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I think that might be okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is riding his Harley, which is loaded with gear (sleeping bag, spare gas tank, saddle bags). He approaches a freeway entrance ramp, where WOODY and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and BOB are waiting on their bikes, next to an entrance ramp sign that reads: U.S. Highway 50. The guys all tap fists, then notice Dudley is grinning ear to ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What's wrong with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a tat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A tattoo? You got a tattoo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a biker, dude! I got a tat! Dudley yanks his jacket down to his elbows and we see he is wearing a sleeveless shirt underneath. On his bicep is a tattoo of the Macintosh Apple. The guys nod, trying to look impressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. That's...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trademarked, I know. But what are they going to do? It's in my skin, bitch! Dudley laughs and pulls on his jacket, as Woody ties a bandana skull-cap on his head. The guys look at Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not wearing a helmet?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nape. I don't want anything between me and the road, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will if your head falls on it. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 30. Woody shrugs and starts his bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, the only rule on this trip is to have no plan. We're riding to San Francisco, and nothing else is planned. Just riding free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if we're going to make it in five days, we'll should probably get to Illinois by tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, the way I mapped it out - we should be a hundred miles past St. Louis by sundown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? No. No plan. It's the open road. Who knows where we'll be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. I have this little GPS system. Doug shows them a handheld GPS system. Woody grabs it and throws it into a storm drain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! What the hell, man? That was expensive!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did it for the good of the trip, Doug. You don't need GPS to discover America. We just need the wind, our bikes, and freedom. And if we have an emergency, I always have a cell phone-- Woody takes out a cellphone. Doug grabs it and throws it in the storm drain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hah! How's that feel? Woody gives Doug a long look, then slowly smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It felt good. It felt damn good. (ANNOUNCES) No cell phones! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 31.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's right, Doug. Wild Hogs! Bob takes his cellphone and throws it in the storm drain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You just did that so Karen wouldn't call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup. Bob starts his bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we're not even going to talk about this? I mean, shouldn't we at least--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeeeeaaah! Freedom!! Dudley throws his cellphone, but instead of going into the storm drain, it goes flying into traffic and smashes against an oncoming pickup truck. We hear the truck screech to a stop after it passes them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, let's ride! The guys all hastily start their bikes and take off up the freeway ramp. We hear the truck driver screaming profanities as they guiltily ride away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. 50 - LATER THAT DAY MUSIC CUE: BLUE OYSTER CULT's "(DON'T FEAR) THE REAPER." The four guys ride along the highway, through the hills of Indiana, smiling and nodding to each other. It's the Easy Rider moment. The camera ROTATES AROUND and PULLS OVERHEAD. It's beautiful country and the guys are in heaven. Dudley wears a clunky helmet from the eighties, as well as World War II motorcycle goggles. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 32. A family in a station wagon pulls up to next to them. Two kids press their faces against the windows, looking at the bikers in awe. Bob looks over at the kids in his mirrored sunglasses and gives them a badass nod. The kids are amazed. Bob looks to Doug. Doug grins. They love this. Bob gives a signal to the other guys and guns his engine. The others nod, gun their engines and speed away from the station wagon. The kids watch with their mouths open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. 50 - LATER THAT AFTERNOON The guys are cruising along as before, but now we see the sky has gotten very cloudy and overcast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THUNDER CRACK The guys look up at the sky apprehensively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. 50 - A FEW MINUTES LATER It's now pouring rain. The guys ride along in misery, getting soaked. After a moment, the station wagon from before pulls back up to them. The kids are still pressed against the window, staring at the drenched bikers. Bob looks over and tries to give them another cocky nod - but now it's just embarrassing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROADSIDE US-50 - THAT EVENING The sun has gone down, and the guys have found a deserted area off the highway to set up camp. DOUG, WOODY and BOB lounge by a fire - with a tent set up behind them. Doug is roasting marshmallows and Bob is straining to blow up an air mattress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you just bring a sleeping bag like us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is more comfortable. (blows a breath into it) I wish Karen would have let me buy the foot pump, though. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 33. Bob continues to inflate the mattress, as Dudley approaches with a knotted plastic grocery bag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is poop. Don't eat it. Dudley sets the bag aside and has a seat by the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley? You're supposed to bury that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Go bury it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's in a plastic bag. I can't put that in the earth. I'll find a trash bin tomorrow. The guys shake their heads and look back into the fire. After a moment, Doug smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is really nice, you know? Chilling by the fire with your best friends. Just relaxing, and enjoying--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. Dudley, you have to get rid of that bag or I'm going to vomit in your lap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --each other's company... Dudley grabs the bag and heads off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. I'll just hang it on a tree.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yells after him) Don't hang it on a tree!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup... These are the times we'll remember. After a minute, Doug turns to Woody and Bob. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 34.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, when was the last time you guys heard me sing Bon Jovi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, man. Thank God that stopped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been awhile. You're not as obnoxious as you used to be. You used to eat a lot more buffalo wings, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I know. Turns out there's carbs in the batter. Hey, you know what? Maybe carbs are what I need to get old Doug back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Doug? You've lost your Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I think I've lost me. It's this thing Kelly said. (BEAT) You know what it is? I think I'm tame. I'm like a lion that used to be wild, but now I'm in some Disney park where tourists come by and take pictures of me like I'm a lion, but after they leave, I go into my kennel and eat antelope nuggets or something. Ones without carbs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you're talking about. I lost old Bob, too. I think my wife and daughters killed him. I'm surrounded by women every minute of my life. And it's made me, you know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wimp?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? No. I was going to say miserable. You think I'm a wimp?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I just thought that was what you were... I thought you wanted us to guess, and I didn't have a guess, so I said "wimp." Knowing it was wrong... "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 35.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a wimp, Bob. I'll say it. You're afraid of girls. It's embarrassing. Dudley comes up and sits back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid of girls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're afraid to talk to one. Bob is afraid they'll kill him in his sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Now I really don't want to talk to one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, it's not always so bad. Like, when Karen sleeps, she still crawls over and pushes up against me. Just snuggles right up like she needs me. I like that. I like that a lot. (then, sobering) Then the sun comes up and turns her into a raging she-demon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I guess life just isn't as simple as it was when we were in college. Well, except for you, Woody. You're still living the fairy tale. Swimsuit model wife. Big job at an investment firm. You've got the good life. Woody doesn't respond. He just stares vacantly into the fire for a beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... The good life. I'm a lucky man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My life blows. I don't have a family. Or a wife. I have a cat that doesn't like me. She wouldn't even stick around if she knew how to use a can opener. The guys all look at Dudley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Dudley. You've got us, buddy. And you're going to get a woman, too. (MORE) "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 36 BOB (CONT'D) I told you we were going to hit some strip clubs when we get back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah, I don't like those places--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley-- Please. I'm trying to help you here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. I just don't--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please! Strippers are nice to me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay... Sorry. We'll go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, man. (THEN) I'm just... trying to be a good friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We know, Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a surprise. Doug pulls a flaming marshmallow out of the fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, who wants their marshmallow well-done? The guys just look at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I left that one on too long. Doug flips the stick and the marshmallow goes flying behind him. The guys don't notice - but we see the marshmallow land on the tent and continue to burn. Bob continues to huff on the air mattress. He stops and looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (out of breath) I think I'm half way there. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 37.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In just one hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sure you don't want us to spread out a sleeping bag? We have three in the-- Doug turns around and sees a foot-wide flame now burning on the tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit! The tent-- Doug and the guys jump up and hurry over to the tent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley, get the water jug off my bike! Dudley hurries over to Doug's bike as Doug and Bob try to smother the flame with sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It should be okay. It's fire retardant. The guys try and extinguish the flame as Dudley comes running with a jug. He quickly takes off the cap. Doug notices him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley, no! That's It's too late. Dudley is already throwing it on the fire. The liquid hits the tent and it explodes into flames. The guys shield themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gas! That's the spare gas tank, Dudley! Dudley doesn't know what to say. The fire quickly disentergrates the tent. Doug, Bob and Woody just watch, knowing there's nothing they can do. After a moment,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: runs back up with the correct water jug and empties it on what is now a flaming pile of ash. It does nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need more water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was all of it, Dudley. That was all the water we had. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 38.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Dudley takes this in for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is anybody else thirsty? The guys just look at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and DUDLEY are all sleeping on Bob's air mattress, like four sardines. Doug opens his eyes to see a large figure standing at the foot of the air mattress. It's a stern-looking highway patrolman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Yeah, just on a road trip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Just making sure. (BEAT) Looks pretty comfortable, actually. We see the highway patrolman has started rubbing his thigh. Doug quickly jumps up, waking the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, well... Thanks for stopping. Have a nice day, officer. The highway patrolman laughs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, I get it. (WINKS) Five's a crowd. Doug is mortified. The officer looks them over for a moment.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: ROADSIDE US-50 -- THE NEXT MORNING BOB, DOUG, WOODY

direction.raw_text: You guys are lucky to have each other. (looks at them hungrily) Damn lucky. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 39.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I always say. Dudley gets up and puts his arm around Doug. We see he's wearing a saggy pair of briefs and nothing else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... Have a good one. The patrolman walks off. Dudley looks at Doug and grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please put your pants on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. 50 - LATER THAT AFTERNOON The guys cruise through the rolling prairies of Missouri. It's another beautiful day. They ride in formation, until Woody's bandana doo-rag blows off. Woody goes back to get it. The other guys stop and wait for him to return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. 50 - LATER The guys are still riding - but now the heat of the Missouri plains is taking it's toll. They look boiling, and have sweated through their clothes. Bob takes a drink of water from a bottle of water, then pours the water over his head. He breathes a sigh of relief, until he hears an angry yell behind him. He looks back and sees Woody is now drenched from the water. Bob smiles sheepishly as Woody burns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. 50 - LATER THAT DAY The guys ride through the forested Ozark uplands, looking even hotter than before. Doug spots a waterfall pouring into a crystal clear spring, and points to it. The guys nod in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 40.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and DUDLEY wade into the spring water in their boxers. You can see on their faces that it's like dipping into heaven. After a moment, BOB walks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for waiting for me, jerks. The guys look up to see that Bob is naked. He smiles and cannonballs into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.C. From kitchen area) God Dammit! What'd we do to deserve this!? We ANGLE TO SEE: MAGGIE rush over to calm BUD down. Bud calms down, then hears another motorcycle engine roaring down the street. He looks out the window and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not another one of these assholes. A moment later, MURDOCK, a fat, grungy Hells Angel, enters the diner with a cocky swagger and has a seat at the bar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me a beer, old man. And if it's not good, I'm going to smash it across your face. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 60.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The WILD HOGS, watching from the table behind Murdock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sotto, to the guys) Not another one of these assholes. Murdock hears this and whips around to see the Wild Hogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I was actually referring to some guys we met at a bar about two hundred miles east of here. You're probably not
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my gang. I'm on my way there now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (loudly, to Doug) so he is one of those assholes, Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me? Murdock puts his beer down, and stares angrily at Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who the hell are you freaks? Doug starts to answer, but Woody, looking nervous, cuts him off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Oh, we're just a group of friends. No big deal. Your guys gave us permission to pass by, so it's all good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hells Angel's don't give permission. Especially to a bunch of ball-less wimps like you. Bob hammers the table and stands up - his face red with long-suppressed rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a wimp, pal'. I'm a man! You got that? Huh? You got that!! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 61. The guys look at Bob, wide-eyed. woody looks worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob, let's not get carried away--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you know what? This guy needs a talking to just like his friends did, Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, Bob. I don't think--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me do this, Woody! You stood up to them last time, and I just sat there like I always do... Well, not this time! (turns to Murdock) Listen, you piece of shit. You think you can just walk around and bully perfectly nice people? You think that's how it works? Well, guess what? This is the real world. With real laws and real consequences. You hear me!? Bob swats Murdock's beer out of his hand. It spills all over him. Murdock is too filled with rage to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now get out of here! And if that gang of inbred assholes needs things explained to them again, tell 'em the Wild Hogs will be right here in Lucas tonight. Woody puts his face into his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now get. Murdock just stares daggers at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get! Bob kicks the stool out from under Murdock. He almost falls, but catches himself on a stool. He glares at the guys, but he's outnumbered. He grits his teeth and storms out the door. Woody winces to himself as he watches Murdock go. This isn't good. After a moment, BUD comes running out from behind the bar. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 62.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait... You guys aren't Hells Angels?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Us? Oh, no. We're from Cincinnati. Bud calls out to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charley!? They ain't the bad ones!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the sheriff from before, stands up from behind a countertop in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys aren't Hells Angels?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We're Wild Hogs. That's our gang. (THEN) And our rotary club softball team... My wife had extra patches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sweet Mary Joseph... Welcome to Lucas! I'm the sheriff, Charley Baskins. I keep the peace here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weren't you just hiding in the kitchen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... A non-confrontation approach sometimes is the best method to keep aggression... (GIVES UP) Yeah, I was hiding in the kitchen. Charley looks at them for a moment, then starts to tear up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm an embarrassment. Charley hurries off to the bathroom. The guys look at each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now he is. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 63.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: walks through the town square with DOUG, BOB, WOODY and DUDLEY. There's a stage and booths set up around the park in the center - ready for the block party. As the news spreads that the Wild Hogs are friendly, the townspeople start to take to the streets again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about all the confusion when you arrived. Those guys are pretty rough. You're the first people to ever stand up to them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Woody is the one who really--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey-- we should probably share the credit. I mean, I just basically kicked that guy's ass. Man! You know how good that felt!? Yeah! Bob punches a handicapped parking sign, which rattles against its post, then falls to the ground. Bob immediately looks regretful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice. Now the paraplegics can park down the block and get more exercise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (suddenly meek again) Should I fix it? Oh, man. I should. (TO CHARLEY) I'm sorry... I didn't mean to--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget about it. We only have one cripple and he gets pulled around in a wagon. Come on, I want to show you guys something. Charley leads the guys off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charley flips on the light in a neatly organized police garage. In the middle sits a sparkling, unridden Harley Davidson police bike. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 64.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. That's fantastic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ride this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. The Hells Angels would take it to pieces if they ever saw me on it. I just keep it in here. Polish it and so forth. But I'd never let them see it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those guys are that big of a problem, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. They ride into town a few times a month and get drunk, damage property... Basically turn the place upside down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the police don't do anything?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, It's a small town - and me and the Dooble brothers are the only law. And they're still pretty green.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you call a bigger town or something for backup?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I've done that a few times. But the gang is always gone by the time they get here. We've also tried wearing riot gear, which does protect you from being hit, but not from being dragged. Also, one of the Dooble brothers tried to throw tear gas, but the bottle exploded and blew off his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ech.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, he's hard to look at. (THEN) Anyway, we want you guys to stay at our hotel tonight on us... Seeing as you're the new town heroes and all. "wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 65. The guys look flattered. Except Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, thanks, but we're actually moving on--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'd be honored to stay. Thank you. Woody's looks at Doug in protest. Doug gives him a stern glare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if you're not in a rush to leave in the morning-- We've got a great trout stream you might want to check out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cool! Let's fish! Doug shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Let's do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh uh. No, I'm putting my foot down, here. I still get a vote on what we do, you know? And I want my vote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Of course you get a vote. Woody nods and looks at Bob and Dudley. They clearly intend to stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I actually get three votes. Because I planned the trip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you didn't plan the voting system. I did. So you only get one. Sorry. Doug, Bob and Dudley walk off. Woody fumes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? Old Doug wasn't such a douchebag! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 66.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has arrived at the bar, which is just a burned shack at this point. The Hell's Angels are gathered around, watching JACK beat the crap out of a remaining wall with a pipe. He finally stops when the wall has crumbled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those assholes think they can cross the Hells Angels? Do you know how bad they've made us all look!? The gang nods. They all look pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those guys have some balls. Balls I will put in my mouth and chew on!! The gang looks at Jack with a slight smile. OILCAN chuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to put balls in your mouth? The gang laughs. Jack realizes what the joke is...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! I'm not-- I'm going to put my foot up their asses! Both feet! Hell, I'm going to stick anything I can in their asses, and I'm going to enlov it. The guys start laughing again. Jack boils red.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up!! I didn't mean-- Just get on your damn bikes! We're riding to Lucas! The guys start towards their bikes. Oilcan sidles up next to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes it helps if you say things in your mind first, then say it out loud, you know? Jack looks at Oilcan for a beat, then bends down, picks a dart up out of the ash, and jabs it into his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oww! Dammit! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 67.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did that in my mind, first. Jack smiles calmly and walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and DUDLEY exit out of an old fashioned hotel next to the diner. They cross to the town square, where the block party is in full swing. Townspeople mingle around eating corn-on-the-cob and hotdogs. Up on the stage, a plump, middle-aged man with a goatee and a polo shirt tucked into dockers - sings Justin Timberlake's "Rock Your body."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you grab your girls, And you grab a couple more. And you all come meet me, in the middle of the floor. Gonna rock your body! 'Till the break of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man drops to his knees at the edge of stage and reaches his hand out to the audience, like the star of a boy band; However, it's clearly making the people on the dance floor uncomfortable. Meanwhile, Doug, Bob, Woody and Dudley walk through the square and are instantly greeted, patted on the back and thanked by each townsperson they pass. The word is out that these guys are heroes. Doug gives a "can you believe this?" look to the other guys - who are just as thrilled as him. They're eating it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These people love us. This is nuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. They think we're bad asses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, let's not get too carried away with it. The truth is we're just regular guys. Let's not forget that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, the best thing is to keep a low profile. Don't cause any waves. Then if somebody pushes us too far, Boom! We go Billy Jack upside their heads! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 68.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're going to go Billy Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nooo. I'm just minding my own business. I don't want to cause any trouble. Dudley turns to Woody and stares at him. Woody looks confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's waiting for you to say something else, then he's going to kick you. Dudley gets a deflated look and backs off of Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug just saved you a world of hurt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're afraid of your cat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well... He once bit me on the sack. Dudley walks off towards the beer tent. Woody looks to the other guys with a puzzled look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's true. He was unclogging his bathtub drain and the cat thought it was a ball of yarn. Doug and Woody wince.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: DUDLEY, at the beer tent. He gets in line, and realizes he's behind MAGGIE. She smiles at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Dudley is wide-eyed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... I, uh--- (SCRAMBLING) What do you call a Mercedes in Harlem? "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 69. Maggie looks confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing-- uh... Maggie notices the tattoo on Dudley's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. You like macs too, huh? I've got a vintage Apple 2e. Restored it from scratch. Dudley's jaw drops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: have a cookie jar made out of a 2e. For fig newtons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. I like fig newtons. Dudley collects himself and tries to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. They're like fried chicken at a-- No, that's not... Dammit! This is hard. Maggie smiles sweetly as Dudley fumbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to dance? Dudley goes to respond, then decides to just give an emphatic nod. Maggie smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and WOODY are sitting at a picnic table, drinking beer out of plastic cups. They lean back and soak up the small town celebration around them. It's a great night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It doesn't get any better than this, huh? Bob notices Doug getting ready to chomp down on a piece of garlic bread. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 70.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a lot of carbs. Doug stops, mid-bite, and puts the bread down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Bob. You saved me from all that... buttery, garlicky flavor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No he didn't. Woody takes the garlic bread and crams it in his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope you choke on it.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: A FEW MINUTES LATER DOUG, BOB

direction.raw_text: approaches with his two deputies, EARL DOOBLE and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They are chubby, thirty-year old twins - identical in every way, except for the fact that Buck is missing an ear on the right side of his head... which the skin has scarred back over. It doesn't look good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howdy, guys! Welcome to the block party! These are my deputies: Earl and Buck Dooble. Earl shakes the guys hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Earl and he's Buck. Just remember, the brother with the word "ear," in his name, has both on his head. (LAUGHS) I can only say that because I'm on his right side. Which as you can see, is blown off. Earl laughs again, as BUCK extends his hand - oblivious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Buck and this is Earl. Good luck telling us apart! Buck laughs and turns to Charley, exposing his missing ear to the guys. They draw back a little. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 71.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's nice to meet you guys. You've got a great town here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, we got everything here. Good people, good fishing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We do have convicted child molesters, though. We have to disclose that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if they don't have kids, Earl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just to be safe, though. (yells at crowd of people) Hey!! Thomas Milborn! A bookish man with a tweed jacket turns around and looks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Convicted child molester. Thomas Milborn nods glumly and pulls his hands out of his pockets. The guys look at each other uneasily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... Still a nice town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're not a kid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or Thomas Milborn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: DANCE FLOOR AREA:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is on the dance floor with MAGGIE. The middle aged guy on stage is letting loose with a rendition of Usher's "Yeah." Maggie and Dudley dance conservatively for a moment, but as the beat gets ahold of Dudley, he starts getting into it. He starts spinning around at a rapid pace, then drops to his knees, slaps the ground and shakes his head to the music. Maggie watches curiously as Dudley pulls himself along the ground by his elbows - then springs up to his feet and starts a move that resembles a sprinkler. Maggie grins - actually amused by Dudley's rhythmic passion. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 72.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: The Wild Hog's table. The guys sit with Charley, Buck and Earl - watching Dudley with a curious look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like your friend and Maggie are hitting it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. I think he really likes that girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Maggie's a great woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup. Big cans, too. Buck liked her, but you know... He's a deformed freak. Buck, on Earl's left, stares out at Maggie and Dudley, deaf to the conversation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to like that girl... but then I realized, I can do better. The guys look at Buck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, why are you guys taking this road trip, anyway?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahh, just to escape for a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, we're not escaping anything, man. We're on this trip to live.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you mean. Sometimes things in life can bother you, and sometimes nothing in life can bother you. Either way, you've got take a break from it. Happiness is somewhere between boredom and stress. Doug is surprised at Charley's insight. So is Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly. Which is why we need to keep riding until we figure out where that happiness is. You don't get old Doug back by just staying put. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 73.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old Doug?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Apparently I've lost him. I don't sing Bon Jovi anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did lose him, Doug. You know why? You're housebroken. You're too comfortable. You've got to snap out of it! Doug nods halfheartedly. He knows woody might be right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woody's got a point, there. Comfortable can be a bad thing. You have to wake up and slap the bull once in a while.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right! Slap the bull! (then, to Charley) What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slapping the bull is kind of the local test of manhood. It's a way to prove you aren't controlled by fear. We've all done it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup. Even torn-open head, here. He nods at Buck, on his left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, I slapped the bull once. Woody smiles slyly. Doug looks concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're slapping the bull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think we need to. I mean, we can have our own test of manhood. Let's see how many ears of corn we can eat or something. I'll start. Doug grabs an ear of corn and takes a bite, but Woody just grins with that reckless look in his eyes. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 74.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are slapping the bull. Doug knows it's no use. He nods, defeated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and EARL approach a fence surrounding a pasture. Charley smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we are. The Lucas test of manhood. Slap the bull. Charley gestures to a lone bull grazing in the pasture. He's a frighteningly large bull with enormous horns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. So it's literally slapping a bull?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yup. Right on the ass. Then high-tail it out of there, because he can kill ya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Um... Woody? This was your idea, so... go ahead. Woody nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. I'm going in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell yeah. I'm gonna slap the shit out of that bull. Like, pimp-style. The guys look at him, surprised and somewhat impressed. Woody takes a breath and climbs over the fence. He approaches the Bull very quietly and cautiously. He gets within three feet of it, leans in and slaps the Bull hard on the ass. The bull makes an annoyed sound and turns around, but Woody is already hightailing it back to the fence, with an exhilarated look on his face. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 75.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whhhheeeeeeew! Woody gets to the fence and hurls himself over. The guys all applaud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! Wow! That felt so good. I just slapped a big fat bull right on his ass! Did you hear how pissed he was!? I just pissed of a bull! (back to Bull) Bitch! Woody high fives all the guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. I'm in. I'm slapping that bull. The guys cheer as Doug climbs over the fence and starts heading towards the Bull. The group all leans on the fence, watching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks for bringing us out here. Doug really needs this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. This is good for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Glad we could help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, and we've never seen it done twice in a row. It'll be interesting to see how the bull takes being slapped now that he's alert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alert? Woody and Bob look at each other, then to the Bull - which Doug is about to slap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug, wait! It's too late. Doug slaps the bull hard, and turns to run. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 76.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wheeeeew!! Yeah! Doug runs across the field, but the Bull - now fully alert - swivels with magnificent agility and breaks into an angry charge towards Doug. The guys all watch in horror as the Bull quickly gains on Doug. Doug sees the fear on the guys faces and looks back over his shoulder. His smile quickly turns to terror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhhhhhhh! It's too late. The Bull catches Doug and bucks him into the air. Doug flies ten feet and comes crashing down on the muddy grass. The Bull takes a few steps back and starts lining up another charge at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no you don't! Woody jumps over the fence and runs into the field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Heeeeey! Hey you! Come get me, Bull! The Bull notices Woody and starts to Charge him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run, Doug! Go! Doug climbs to his feet and sees the bull charging Woody. Woody realizes he's in trouble and starts to run again. The bull quickly catches him and rams him into the air. Woody lands hard, with a grunt. The bull turns back to charge at Woody again, and Bob jumps over the fence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Leave him alone! You want some of this!? Come get this! Bob sprints out into the field. The bull snorts and starts towards him. The Bull closes on Bob quick, but at the last moment Bob dives of the way. The bull goes flying past him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hah! Missed me, you fat bastard! "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 77. Doug and Woody look impressed as Bob helps them hurry towards the fence. Charley and Buck hold a gate open for them as the Bull makes a turn and lines the group up, but they've already made it to the gate. They go through and Charley shuts it behind them. They lean back on the fence, trying to gather their bearings, except Bob - who is thrilled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you see me? I dodged him! I dodged that stupid cow! How cool am-- Suddenly, the Bull charges into the fence, which Bob's butt is sticking through. Bob goes flying and lands face down in the dirt. He scrambles back up, furious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You son of a bitch! You want to keep it going!? You want to take cheap shots!? Come on! Bob tries to climb back into the pasture, but the guys restrain him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me your gun! Give me the gun! He deserves it! (TO BULL) I'll kill you! Doug and Woody hold on to Bob until he calms down. Doug and Woody start to laugh. Bob cools off for another moment, then starts laughing as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No this is living!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We just slapped the bull! The group high fives each other in congratulations, and starts away: Bruised, muddy and laughing.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: EXT.
location: THAT EVENING DOUG, BOB, WOODY, CHARLEY, BUCK

direction.raw_text: ON: THE BULL. He pushes on the gate that Charley was holding open. The gate swings open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: WOODY, BOB and DOUG. They walk with Charley and the Dooble brothers, laughing and carrying on. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 78. Bob does an impression of how he dodged it and goes for some more high fives - but suddenly, the bull charges into frame and nails him. As Bob goes flying; we:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The block party is winding down. Dudley is sitting by himself at a picnic table, in post-Maggie bliss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and BOB approach, dirty and beaten from the bull - but, carrying on happily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, did you see the look on Bob's face when he got up? Didn't dodge him that time! Woody and Doug laugh. Bob looks pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to go back there with a rifle tomorrow and shoot one of his legs off. Then we'll see who's tough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why just one leg?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I want to kick him in the face. Doug and Woody laugh again. Bob just steams. They spot
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and head over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Dud. You look happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I danced with her. And she likes macs. You know what that means?

direction.raw_text: You have a sister?
