direction.raw_text: They're coming. Buck's ear is giving him some equilibrium problems. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 99.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: holding the door open for BUCK, who walks through slowly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just keep your eyes forward and head up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm fine. Buck walks a few more steps, then starts to tilt left. He quickly loses his balance and falls sideways, taking out a card table full of food and the old man sitting at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit. Earl helps Buck up and they join the guys at their table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, guys. Having your final meal? Buck and Earl laugh. Nobody else does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sternly, to Buck and Earl) That's out of line, guys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Buck looks around the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, isn't one of you missing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Dudley's with Maggie somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and approaches the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, guys. Where's Dudley?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's with you, isn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I thought he went to find you guys. Doug shares a worried glance with Bob and Woody. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 100.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charley, can I borrow your phone? Charley hands it to him, and Doug starts to dial.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dudley has mine. I'll just call him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He has a phone? What happened to freedom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He needed to call his answering machine so his cat could hear his voice. (THEN) Here we go. It's ringing... (TO MAGGIE) He probably snuck off somewhere to buy you some romantic gift or something. No big deal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it. He's never had a girlfriend so he's probably getting carried away. He once drank eighteen Mocha Latte's because the Starbucks clerk was smiling at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I remember that. His pee turned brown and he started crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. And the girl wasn't even smiling - she just had a cleft lip. (INTO PHONE) Hello? Dudley?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: MAGGIE COMES OUT OF THE KITCHEN

direction.raw_text: Jack stands next to Dudley, who is duct-taped to a chair with so much tape that it looks like he's in a cocoon. Only his head is uncovered. Jack holds Dudley's cellphone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try again, asshole. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 101.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (knowingly, to group) Nope. The Hells Angels have him. Doug gives a look to the other guys. They mouth "Shit:"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn right, the Hells Angels. Your friend paid us a little visit. And now he's hurting reeeeal bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I actually feel pretty-- Jack kicks Dudley's chair with his foot. It tips over and lands on it's side - with Dudley in it. Dudley looks out at the floor, helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow! (THEN) Hey, a peanut. Dudley tries to stick his tongue out to get the peanut. Jack notices and kicks it away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So here's what we're going to do, now. You guys are going to pay us a visit. And you're going to bring a "disobedience fee," of ten thousand dollars. Cash. And don't even think about calling any cops. Just you guys and ten grand. And if you don't show up in an hour - Well then, We'll just take the fine out of your friend's legs... Which we're going to break with a tire iron.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling to phone) Don't bring the money, guys! (MORE) "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 102.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a computer programmer! I don't need my legs! Jack considers this and turns back to the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His hands! We'll break his hands!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dammit. (yelling to phone) Bring the money!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug shakes his head at Dudley's stupidity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll bring the money. Just don't touch our friend!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I won't touch him if you bring that money. But if you don't, I'll be touching him all night long. And I'll be enjoying it. The other bikers suddenly stifle laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!? There was nothing wrong with that one! That was tough! Those guys are afraid of me, now. They know how much I want 'em! The gang laughs again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shut up!! The gang stops laughing, off Jack's warning glare. Dudley looks up from the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey can we call my cat, now? She needs to hear my voice. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 103. Jack looks down at Dudley, then to the other bikers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get me more duct tape? A biker nods and grabs another role of duct tape. He heads over to Dudley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits in a chair, deep in thought. BOB, WOODY, EARL, BUCK, and BUD stand with other members of the town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is on a couch, sobbing into her hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweet Dudley. He went there to save everybody and now they're going to break his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No they aren't. We're going to get him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We sure are. I'm going to call the Highway Patrol. They'll be there in--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way. They said no law. We can't risk them doing anything to Dudley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob's right. We can call the Highway Patrol after we get Dud back, but we shouldn't piss these guys off while he's still in their hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to call Karen and have the cash wired out of our savings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. No way. This is my fault. All this is my fault. I have some money in my severance package. We're using it. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 104.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, he did this because of me. I have a thousand dollars in tip money I want to put in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have a couple thousand in the diner emergency fund I'll put in, too. Doug, who has been thinking all this over, stands up from his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Nobody is paying anything. Everyone stops and gives Doug a puzzled look. He has a new fire behind his eyes. His suburban quietude has transformed into something more... valiant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not calling the Highway patrol. We're not gathering ten thousand dollars. We're going over there and getting our friend back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think that's the safest plan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not. But sometimes you have to do the things that aren't safe, to create a world that you're happy being in. These Hells Angels don't want our ten thousand dollars. They want our dignity. They want us to be afraid of them just like this town is. And once they know we're afraid, they can do whatever they want. That's how these guys exist. That's how they ride into this town and tear it to pieces... Because people want to keep their lives safe so badly, they give up the best part about it... Doug takes his Wild Hogs jacket and pulls it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .The adventure. Doug looks at Woody and Bob. Woody smiles and pulls on his jacket. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 105.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the friends. Woody steps over to Doug. Bob looks at them for a moment, then finally smiles and pulls on his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go slap the bull. Doug smiles and taps fists with Bob and Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : BLUE OYSTER CULT'S "(DON'T FEAR) THE REAPER."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and WOODY walk along main street, shoulder to shoulder. They look to each other with a smile. Even though they're walking into the mouth of the beast, they're finally who they were in college again. Fearless. They approach the diner and stand out on the street, like gunslingers in the Old West, calling their enemy out of the saloon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : FADE OUT The front door of the bar opens and the HELLS ANGELS swagger out. After a moment, the gang parts and JACK steps out in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, well. The "Wild Hogs." I'm glad to see you're finally showing us a little respect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Dudley? Jack turns back and nods at one of the Hells Angels. They push DUDLEY forward. We see he is now completely cocooned in duct-tape - like a mummy. There is only a small slit for his mouth and eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (muffled from tape) Hey, guyth. Doug shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just hold tight, Dudley. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 106. Dudley tries to nod, but can't. He leans his torso back and forth to signal "yes."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Hand him over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Where's the cash? Doug looks to Bob and Woody. They nod encouragingly. Doug gathers his courage and turns back to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not giving you any money. Jack looks surprised.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going to play your games. We're all adults, here. It's not highschool. I'm sorry your bar got burned down, and we'll be glad to help you get it rebuilt, but we're done being bullied by you. Now give us back Dudley, and get out of this town. The Hells Angels start to laugh. Jack turns back to them and smiles, "Can you believe these guys?" Doug is starting to lose his cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yells to Jack) Give us back our friend, asshole! The Hells Angels are suddenly silent. Jack turns back and looks at Doug in disbelief - then rage. Doug starts to look a little worried.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did you just call me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (losing some confidence) Ass... hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? I was just going to pulverize your friend, here. (MORE) "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 107.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But now I'm pissed off. You're all going to get hurt. Hells Angels style. Guys! The Hells Angles nod and pick up various weapons: Crowbars, tire irons, bats... They start moving towards Doug, Woody and Bob. Bob looks to Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!? I thought they'd back down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can still outrun them. They're fat. Woody turns around to see Hells Angles have now closed in behind them, blocking their escape. Jack smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear that, guys!? He called you all fat!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shit. (to Hells Angels) I meant full-figured. The Hells Angels close to within a few feet of the "Wild Hogs," and raise their weapons to strike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait!! Wait a minute! The Hells Angels stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to beat the shit out of us? Fine. But you outnumber us forty to three. You think there's honor in that? Why don't we make it fair, if you guys are so freaking tough? The leader of our gang against the leader of yours. Jack smirks. He's twice as big as Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me against you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. But not just for Dudley. If you win, we'll give you ten grand and go back home. You'll never see us again. But... If I win, you let Dudley go and you never set foot in Lucas again. This town is off limits to the Hells Angels. Forever. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 108. Jack looks back to the Hells Angels, who chuckle. This will be a quick fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? You in, or are you too much of a bitch? The Hells Angels freeze. Jack grits his teeth in rage and turns back to Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Let's party, tough guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great. Doug nods, trying to look confidant, but it's quickly fading away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and JACK are standing "in their corners," opposite each other in the dirt parking lot. They're surrounded by a circle of Hells Angels, rowdily waiting for the fight to commence. WOODY and BOB coach Doug in his corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just stay clear of the big punches. You've got more stamina than this guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. When do I hit back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... Just try and get him tired. I don't think punches will do much to him. Doug gives Woody a concerned look. Woody shrugs. Jack steps into the circle and throws off his jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time for your beating, yuppie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . "Wild Hogs" writers first draft
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell my wife I won - then got hit by a truck. Doug takes a deep breath and starts into the circle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Let's do this-- Doug doesn't even finish his sentence as Jack lands a punch on the side of his head. Doug is stunned, as Jack sends his other fist crashing into Doug's forehead. Doug goes flying backwards, and falls down in the dirt. The Hells Angels cheer. Jack high fives them as Doug struggles back to his feet and looks back at Woody and Bob, cradling his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow! Dammit Jesus that hurt! (TO WOODY) It really hurts. Damn! Jack comes back over to Doug. Jack throws another right, but this time Doug ducks, still cradling his jaw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes!-- But Doug is instantly punched in the stomach by Jack's other fist. Doug winces as he doubles over in agony. Drool drips out of his mouth. This isn't pretty. Jack takes him by the back of the shirt and lifts him into the air. The Hells Angels cheer as Jack tosses Doug five yards into the dirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get tired yet. The hurt is just beginning. Doug tries to stand back up, but it's getting harder. He slyly grabs a handful of sand as he starts to stand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hah! Doug whips around and throws the sand towards Jack's face; However, his aim is off. The sand hits Jack in the chest and falls away. Jack looks at Doug and shakes his head. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 110.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn. Jack punches Doug square in the face again. Doug crumples to the ground in pain. Jack turns back to the Hells Angels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Man, this isn't even a workout. Jack laughs and puts his aviator sunglasses back on, as Doug quickly stands up and whips around at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhh! Doug throws another handful of sand. This time he aims carefully; but Jack now has sunglasses on. The sand bounces harmlessly off the lenses. Doug cringes and waits for the punch, which comes like a freight train into his stomach. Doug doubles over again as Jack lines up another punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one's gonna break bone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Wait-- Doug straightens up and looks curiously at Jack's mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your tooth-- That's an acute periodontal abscess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: look, I really hate you, but I don't want to feel responsible for a death. I'm a dentist. I took an oath. Same one as doctors. If the infection in that tooth gets to the root - it could seep into your nervous system. Just let me look-- Doug slowly reaches towards Jack's mouth. Jack doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a dentist? "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 111.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. One of the best. And I know when your gums are that swollen and your
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Wham! Doug punches Jack square in the mouth. Jack goes down hard. Woody and Bob cheer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Doug!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick! Start kicking him! Don't let him get up! Doug nods and goes to kick Jack, but Jack grabs the foot and pushes him backwards. Doug falls back to the dirt. Jack stands up and dusts himself off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right. Now you're going to die. Jack approaches Doug, who closes his eyes and waits for the end.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait!! Jack turns around as WOODY walks into the circle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doug's not the leader of this gang. I-- Jack instantly punches Woody in the face. Woody falls down next to Doug. Doug turns his head to Woody. They're both bleeding from their noses and lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. Jack looks at Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anybody else the leader of this gang? Bob takes a deep breath, and bends down an grabs a long lead pipe. He starts towards Jack. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 112.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, Mother f-- Bob suddenly trips on the lead pipe and hits the ground. Doug shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just stay down. Bob nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I guess that's all of you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: still covered in tape, comes running into the circle from the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhhhhhhhhhh! Dudley charges Jack, but his limited mobility results not in a tackle, but in him leaning on Jack. After a moment, Jack takes a step back and Dudley falls to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow. Jack cracks his knuckles and looks to OILCAN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give me the crowbar. Oilcan nods and hands it to Jack. Jack smiles at the four fallen Wild Hogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guess you guys are wishing you'd listened, now, huh? Jack smiles as we hear:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack and the Hells Angels look up the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: DOWN STREET. CHARLEY is riding his shiny Harley Davidson police bike. Behind him are BUCK and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: driving a police cruiser. Behind the cruiser is a large group of people carrying rakes, hedge clippers, brooms... It's all the citizens of Lucas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: Hells Angels. They're stunned. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 113.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls up to the group and gets off his motorcycle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, Jack. That'll be enough of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding? And what makes you think you can ride a motorcycle without our permission?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll ride whatever I want from now on. I'm the sheriff of Lucas, and I'm not tolerating any more lawlessness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: helps DOUG, WOODY, and DUDLEY to their feet, as Jack takes a step towards Charley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd stop right there, Jack. Earl and Buck get out of the cruiser with two shotguns. They cock the guns and walk to Charley's side. Jack looks concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You're going to shoot us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Not unless you want to do something stupid like ignoring-- Buck grabs his missing ear as he starts to loose his balance. He tips over and falls. As he hits the ground, the shotgun fires and hits OILCAN in the leg. Oilcan falls to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhhhhh! He shot me! I just got shot!! Charley looks over at Buck, then back to Jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... Yeah, I guess we're going to shoot you. The Hells Angels suddenly look nervous, and back up a few steps. Charley steps towards Jack. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 114.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not going to live in fear of your gang anymore, Jack. If the Wild Hogs can stand up to you - so can everyone of us. The crowd of townspeople gathers behind Charley and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. You mess up our town, we'll do the same to you! The crowd cheers as THOMAS MILBORN, the guy Earl pointed out as a child molester, steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah! People like you are the scum of the earth! The crowd is silent for a moment, then hesitantly gives a uncomfortable cheer. Charley turns back to the Hells Angels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The point is, from now on you need to treat Lucas with kindness and respect. And when you do, you'll be treated the same. And if you don't... Charley looks over at OILCAN, who's tending to the bullet wound in his thigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I guess we'll keep... shooting you. Got it? Jack looks at all the townspeople. He knows he's beaten. He nods bitterly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Now I'd like you to untape our friend Dudley. Jack signals to one of the Hells Angels. He grabs Dudley's tape and spins him around to untape him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ow. Ow! Ow, ow. Ow. Ow!... After a painful minute, Dudley is untaped. Charley looks at Jack's jacket. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 115.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I believe that's his jacket. Jack begrudgingly takes off Dudley's "Wild Hogs" jacket and tosses it to him. Dudley proudly puts it on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And as I recall, that '51 Panhead was traded to Dudley. Jack looks over at the mint condition motorcycle and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way. He can have his Sportster back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh uh. A deal's a deal, Jack. Jack grits his teeth and throws a set of keys at Dudley. The crowd chatters in approval as Dudley gets on the '51 Panhead and starts the engine. He revs it a few times and Jack shoots Doug an infuriated glare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hope you're happy. You suburban posers are a disease. You need to learn some damn respect for real bikers. Doug smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You still don't get it do you, Jack?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are the real bikers. As Doug says this, Dudley kicks the Panhead into gear and shoots forward - out of control. He instantly crashes into a steel light post. Everyone in the crowd cringes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the bike falls over in a crumpled heap. up from the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I'll take the Sportster back, I guess. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 116. Jack just stares at the trashed motorcycle, mortified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's later that afternoon in Lucas. DOUG, BOB and WOODY walk to their motorcycles with CHARLEY, EARL and BUCK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I wish you guys would stay longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahh, we should be heading back. I think we've had enough excitement for one trip. Earl steps forward and shakes Doug's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You guys were a blessing to this place. I mean... I'm not going to get all emotional like "hamburger head" here always does. Earl laughs and looks to his left. Buck isn't there. He quickly looks to the right, where Buck is staring at him in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'd you just call me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just a little scar! I'm still better looking than you! Buck goes to storm off, but after a few steps, tilts left and falls over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dammit! Doug shakes his head, then turns to Woody and Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Woody and Bob) You guys ready to head back? "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 117. Woody takes a deep breath and shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? I think I'm going to press on. Keep heading West.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Why not? I feel good about my life again. And I'd like to see what San Francisco's all about. Doug nods and looks to Bob. You can tell he wants to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm in, too! Let's ride to San-- Suddenly, a mini-van pulls up. KAREN and KELLY hop out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karen? / Kelly?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you I was coming, Bob!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, honey. Kelly kisses Doug. He smiles, glad to see her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, baby. What are you doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Karen said you guys were in trouble. I kept calling your cell, but somebody programmed it to not receive calls from our house. Doug shoots Woody a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. Woody hurries over to his bike. KAREN turns to BOB. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 118.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I hope you guys had a nice trip. Now get in the van. We're going home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um... Actually, we just decided we were going to keep pressing West for a few--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no. No way! I came all the way out here, rented a car, drove to this podunk
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Karen is saying this, Bob looks over at the guys, then back to Karen. He can't take it anymore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --Karen! Karen stops talking, shocked by Bob raising his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen to me. This is My vacation and if I want to ride on with my friends, well that's what I'm going to do! And if you have a problem with that, well... Tough shit! There's a moment of silence as Karen absorbs this. The guys all look at Bob proudly. After a few seconds, Karen's face softens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Sorry... Just... be careful. Karen shyly kisses Bob on the cheek. Bob can't believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will. And... I love you. Bob smiles at her and gets on his bike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON: DOUG and KELLY. Kelly looks at Doug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So are you going, too?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hadn't really decided. I have been having a good time, though. (MORE) "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 119.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I even got beaten up. Doug winks cockily. Kelly lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There he is! I saw old Doug! Doug blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You'll see him even more if you and Billy meet me in San Francisco. We've got a suite at the Ritz-Carlton. Doug smiles and gets onto his motorcycle. Kelly looks concerned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about work? And Billy's school? Doug shrugs like he hasn't a care in the world.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahh. We can risk it. Kelly smiles and kisses him proudly. Doug grabs her face and kisses her back... Then, turns to Woody and Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think so. Dudley? What do you think? The camera PULLS OUT to reveal DUDLEY, sitting on his motorcycle. Next to him, is MAGGIE, sitting in the rusty sidecar now attached to Dudley's bike. She's wearing Dudley's goggles and nods to him encouragingly. Dudley looks back over to Doug, Bob and Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's ride. They start their motorcycles. The engines roar to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .S. 50 - LATER THAT DAY The four motorcycles (and one sidecar) cruise down the open highway. The guys smile as the wind blows in their faces. "Wild Hogs" writers first draft 7/06/05 120. It's freedom, joy and friendship all wrapped up in one expression. The camera PANS AROUND THEM, and finally
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S IN ON DOUG. We see his eyes sparkle a little bit, and he opens his mouth:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I walk these streets, a loaded six string on my back. I play for keeps, 'cause I might not make it back... I'm a cowboy, on a steel horse I ride! I'm wanted... The other guys smile and join in:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead or alive! They all look at each other as they continue to sing over the roar of the engines:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohh, I'm a cowboy, I got the night on my side!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wante-ee--ed!
direction.name: direction
